Greencap is the largest integrated risk management and compliance company in Australia and New Zealand delivering Work Health and Safety, Property and Environmental risk management solutions.Greencap serves thousands of private and government clients in the education, property, resources, industrial, manufacturing, retail and services sectors.Greencap partners with clients to understand their needs, allowing us to deliver tailored risk management solutions that protect our client’s most valued assets; their People, Property and Environment.


With over 300 professional, technical and engineering employees based in 9 offices across Australia and New Zealand, we are now seeking to appoint a Regional Practice Manager - WHS to drive, develop and grow our business in VIC!


The role:


An opportunity presents for a committed and experienced Practice Manager to lead, manage and motivate the regional practice team in delivering budgeted business performance targets. Based in our Head Office in Kew East, VIC, you will focus on leading and growing the WHS function to enable the effective implementation of the region’s strategic initiatives, optimising service delivery, developing and maintaining excellent relationships with clients, achieving growth targets and improving profitability.


Key responsibilities:


Reporting to the Regional Operations Manager, your key responsibilities will be:



  • Delivering on regional practice and product growth to meet profit margin and business targets.

  • Build a pipeline of business opportunities and a secure work profile that will ensure regional practice revenue targets are achieved.

  • Managing projects at a state and national level.

  • Identifying and developing talent within the team.


Qualifications, Skills & Experience:



  • A strong leader with extensive experience in WHS, OHS and risk management within a people management role, ideally within a consultancy business.

  • A strategic thinker who takes a hands on approach and is solutions orientated with strong commercial acumen.

  • Ability to mentor, motivate and drive a team as well as effective relationship building skills with internal and external stakeholders is essential.

We are on the cusp of an ambitious growth and change phase. It’s an exciting time to build your career with Greencap!

EHS Manager

Company Name Wilmar Sugar Australia Limited Company Location 265 Whitehall Street Yarraville, Melbourne, VIC 3013, AU

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 30 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the Company


Wilmar International Limited, founded in 1991 and headquartered in Singapore, is today Asia's leading agribusiness group. Wilmar's business activities include oil palm cultivation, oilseeds crushing edible oils refining, sugar milling and refining, specialty fats, oleo chemicals, biodiesel and fertiliser manufacturing and grains processing. We have over 450 manufacturing plants in 13 countries and an extensive distribution network covering China, India, Indonesia and some 50 other countries, backed by a multinational workforce of about 90,000 people.


Wilmar is the leader in sugar and renewable energy. Our sugar operations follow a natural and sustainable cycle - creating renewable energy and fuel from sugarcane by-products, and producing fertilizers which are applied to cane fields.


We are experts in raw sugar production, market champions in sweeteners, and progressive thought leaders in the energetic pursuit of sugar as a renewable and sustainable resource.


Job Vacancy


An exciting opportunity exists within our Sugar Australia EHS team for an experienced EHS Manager to commence immediately at our Yarraville site.


Reporting directly to the National Head of Operations, you will be responsible for the implementation and administration of EHS policies, processes and practices as well as continuous improvement across our Yarraville Packing and Refinery facility, Yarraville Head Office and our North Freemantle Depot site.


You will be responsible for:

  • Lead the safety, health and environment requirements of the site to ensure business compliance, engagement behind continuous improvement and to support the total business strategy
  • Developing a Health & Safety plan that aligns people and teams with the National EHS strategy and objectives.
  • Maintaining and participate in the EHS Internal Audit program and participate in Wilmar EHS Audits as required
  • Providing hands on support, EHS advice and coaching to managers and employees
  • Administering and maintaining the quality of data within Enablon, Risk Management System and Chemical Management System (ChemAlert)
  • Managing injury management and return to work programs


The Successful Candidate

  • Tertiary qualification in OHS
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience in:
  • Rehabilitation and Return to Work Coordination
  • Internal auditing
  • Incident Investigation (preferably ICAM) training is desirable
  • Minimum 5 years of Safety related practical experience with preferred exposure to manufacturing
  • Demonstrated experience in developing, implementing and maintaining EHS Management Systems
  • EHS auditing certification or knowledge and experience preferred
  • EHS & Risk Management software (i.e. Enablon) experience preferred
  • Introduction of change and experience with change management systems
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills at all levels of the organization


How to apply

Confidential applications should be submitted online by hitting the "Apply now!" button below.

Systems Engineer

Company Name Pure Storage Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 62 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Us

Our ambitious goal of helping innovators build a better world with data started in 2009. Today, we are one of the fastest growing enterprise companies in history, surpassing $1B in revenue at the end of 2017.

The world is experiencing a technological revolution driven by AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing and self-driving cars -- all of which require large amounts of data and put Pure’s technology literally in the driver’s seat. Our solutions deliver real-time, secure data to power mission-critical production, DevOps, and modern analytics in multi-cloud environments. With a Satmetrix NPS score in the top 1% of B2B companies worldwide, our customer-first culture and commitment to innovation create a thriving company that employees, customers, partners, and investors love . For more information on our business, check out the corporate fact sheet .

What You Will Be Doing
  • Demonstrate thought- and practice-leadership as a senior member of our SE team
  • Participate in the creation of sales strategy and tactics and takes ownership of technical responsibilities within customer accounts
  • Assist customers with evaluations and benchmarks, system configurations, and system installations
  • Work closely with Engineering and Product Management in helping to define product requirements and usability
  • Demonstrate technical leadership and subject matter expertise on storage products, distributed storage architectures, file systems, and competitive storage offerings in the DAS, NAS and SAN product spaces
  • Mentor other team members to continually advance their technical and customer acumen


What You Bring To The Team
  • 8-10 years minimum experience supporting the sales of enterprise storage, networking or systems solutions to a combination of large enterprise accounts and data centers
  • Thorough understanding of the architecture, design and implementations of multi-tiered client/server and web-based computing solutions
  • Preparation and delivery of technical product and architecture presentation
  • Contribute significant portions and/or lead responses to RFPs, RFQs and RFIs
  • Superior knowledge of current and emerging storage architectures (FC, iSCSI, NAS, OSD, SAN)
  • Familiarity with modern web architecture a plus (LAMP stack, scale-out vs scale-up architectures, NoSQL alternatives)
  • UNIX OS, NFS file systems, and UNIX distributed network environment
  • Installation/configuration of distributed computing, multiprocessing, virtual memory subsystem, storage subsystems architecture, shared memory architectures, cache architectures, windowing systems
  • Knowledge of VMWare, Local Area Networking, Ethernet, TCP/IP and general networking
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • BS in CS, EE or other technical degree and/or equivalent experience.

No Storage? No Problem.

We look for talent and culture first, specific technologies second, so once you decide Pure is the right place for you, we will match you with the right project to start with. Plus, we like people to have the ability to do different things and be constantly learning, so we encourage our engineers to move around to different teams and project across the company.

Popular Perks

Our rewards philosophy is tailored to provide Puritans globally competitive compensation and benefit programs that enable innovation and growth. We offer a wide variety of benefits and perks including comprehensive medical insurance, meal service, opportunities to attend events, join sports leagues, employee assistance program, work-life services, travel assistance, and employee resource groups – all of which are thoughtfully designed to maintain mind and body wellness. Through our Pure Good Foundation, we also offer numerous volunteer opportunities for employees to give back across the globe.

\xa0

While you are highly organised, super reliable and love putting on events, your passion is centred around supporting high performing teams and creating fun, collaborative workplace experiences.

\xa0

You might have a background supporting high growth start-ups, or perhaps you’ve predominately worked for large corporates and are looking to join an emerging organisation where you can be part of the story and make a lasting impact.

\xa0

As part of your application, we’d really love to know what you’re looking for in your next role, what you would be able to bring to the Hardhat team and what you believe is the key to your success.


\xa0

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES

  • Be the friendly face that receives visitors at the door and makes them feel welcome
  • Be the familiar voice that greets them on the phone and know who’s calling, where to direct them and how to help out when it’s up to them
  • Know the schedule of who is in and out of the agency each day and which visitors are expected
  • Be a reliable and dependable assistant to the Directors, exercising professional discretion when needed
  • Effectively manage the diaries of the Directors to help them get the most out of their days
  • Set and maintain the standard of office appearance, including setting up and resetting for meetings, workshops and events
  • Manage external contractors, including cleaners and IT support
  • Provide support to the Management Team for ad-hoc requests
  • Be a key contributor and leader to the Social Committee
  • Coordinate and manage events, including our quarterly event series Real Big Things
  • Facilitate Welcome Days and onboarding new team members

Job description

Digital Marketing & Campaigns Lead


As an ASX listed alternative to the NBN, Spirit Telecom Ltd is disrupting the Internet market in Australia. We’ve built our own off-the-charts-fast network and we need your help to keep getting the word out there.


We provide high speed internet to The Block, Eureka Towers and many other buildings, businesses and consumers around Australia, big and small. And we’re growing ...


We have been rated as Australia’s fastest internet service provider*, so we pride ourselves on being fast moving, as well as great to work for. We give our customers top-shelf products and services and we give our employees opportunities to grow, good coffee, Fridays drinks and a brand new office to kick goals from. It’s a pretty exciting time to be part of our journey.


Take yourself to new heights!


This role would suit someone who is interested in broadening their generalist marketing skills and developing their leadership potential across the integrated marketing landscape.

We are looking for an up and coming Digital Marketing & Campaigns Lead to build our B2C and B2B digital presence and campaigns.


Reporting to the Senior Manager - Growth Marketing, you will work together to bring our brand message to life, eclipse our acquisition targets and expand our reach. We will provide you with the support to use the necessary tools and give you a runway to take the reins with initiative and creativity.


Key responsibilities include:


While no two days will be the same and you’ll have your fingers in a lot of pies, we don’t expect you to be an expert in everything, nor work in a vacuum on your own. If you can tick many of these boxes, but not all perfectly, that’s ok, don’t hold back from applying. We’re prepared to help you upskill if you can already demonstrate that you’re well on your way to trying to master all things digital marketing.


  • Execute and optimise multi-channel campaigns
  • Set up, manage and optimise Google Ads including keyword lists, ad copy, bid strategies, and budgets that drive click-through rates
  • Develop conversion goal oriented retargeting strategies and campaigns
  • Contribute to improving our SEO via content generation
  • Grow social media presence (paid and organic) and assist with community engagement
  • Support offline channel execution including direct and brand activation/experiential marketing
  • Be a point of contact for external agencies and suppliers
  • Creation of new processes and procedures to scale marketing activity and drive efficiencies

\xa0

Your experience:


  • 3+ years’ experience in a similar role
  • Experience designing the rollout of successful campaigns that drive customer engagement, advocacy and leads
  • Some working knowledge of the Google product suite (particularly Ads and Analytics). Google certified candidates will be highly regarded, but not essential
  • Analytical mindset to derive insights from data
  • Able to work across various marketing automation and digital platforms
  • Content marketing and social media account management, including Facebook Business Manager
  • Active in staying up to date with new trends, technologies and emerging opportunities
  • A positive and motivated self-starter with confidence in your ability to problem solve
  • Flexible mindset able to adapt to constant changes in process
  • Exceptional project management skills and attention to detail
  • Tertiary qualifications in Marketing, Communications, Business or similar field desirable

\xa0

Have you got the Spirit?


We think you’ll have fun working here. Spirit can help you continue to grow your knowledge and career. We’ve got a cool office in South Melbourne with great views and Spirit’s own super-fast internet connected. Apply now so you can come and see for yourself how fast and friendly we are.


No recruiters, please


You must be an Australian Citizen or Australian Permanent resident to be eligible for this role.


Only shortlisted applicants will be notified

This is a brand new role, working with our Head of Client Engagement. You will have the opportunity to work autonomously by shaping and driving your own business development plan through new and existing relationships, whilst also being supported by strong technical and client engagement leaders.


About you:

  • You’ll have experience in developing strong relationships with technical and business leaders
  • Experience in working with clients to shape digital and cloud projects/solutions
  • It would be advantageous if you have worked with partners such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP) and Amazon Web Services (AWS)
  • You are motivated by building great solution minded teams and delivering outcomes that solve real problems
  • Your definition of success in this role will be defined by client satisfaction and equally that of our team’s
  • Prior experience working within a professional services firm or technical product sales environments
  • Experience winning and executing your own business development plan
  • Strong experience working within Utilities, Technology and/or Telco verticals and ability to leverage existing relationships
  • Ability to take an engagement through the full sales cycle including supporting the scoping phase for delivery


What’s on offer

  • You’ll be joining a passionate and supportive team who’ll move mountains to help you achieve your objective
  • We have a culture of trust. We set clear expectations, provide feedback and opportunities and support you to grow
  • We don’t do policies or performance reviews or hierarchies or bureaucracy
  • We’re growing, so there will be plenty of opportunities to grow your career with us as we expand
  • The building we work in has kombucha, beer, cider on tap, plenty of open space including a rooftop deck and heaps of activities (like yoga, meditation and talks on leading topics) to get involved in to give you a break throughout the day
  • Our approach to business development is not the norm, you will be an extension of our delivery team and will be supported by them to deliver great outcomes
  • We trust you to get the job done and can offer flexible working arrangements
  • We are located in the heart of the CBD where there’s plenty of transportation options to make getting to and from work a breeze
  • You’ll get all the tools you need - a new iphone or Google phone, a laptop, and a lot of branded swag - t-shirts, hoodies, umbrellas, water bottle….
  • Lots of social activities - so far this year we have had regular breakfasts, lunches and drinks, hotly contested table tennis competition, twice weekly squash competitions, regular games nights, ski trip, Grand Prix
  • A learning organisation - we make a huge investment of time and money into our learning - attending conferences, hosting and attending ‘brown bag’ lunches, meet ups and supporting individual learning opportunities
  • Genuine support for your wellbeing including unlimited health leave, flu shots, counselling and psychological services, dietitian and financial advice


Sound like you? If so, we’d love to meet you!

\xa0

884284739:
[

Senior UX Designer

Company Name Our Very Own (Give great ideas a voice) Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 40 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At OVO, we help our clients solve problems, no matter how big or small - enterprise and startups alike… we give great ideas a voice.

We’re a fun and upcoming consultancy based in Melbourne CBD; we’re starting small but with big ambitions. We’re a bunch of designers, developers, product people - that work hard but play hard too.

A fun, inclusive environment that thrives on collaboration and….Tim-Tams ;)

What we're looking for?

We’re looking for a Senior UX Designer to help deliver amazing best-in-class experiences for our clients. You have to be well versed with methodologies such as Lean UX, Lean Startup and of course the HCD principals; but most importantly for a self starter looking to make this role their own!

Working within a growing UX Design practice - you’ll be crafting experiences for our clients on-site and within the Studio. You’ll be super keen to get involved with a Hack day or two (we like to keep it interesting); helping push the OVO design brand where-ever you go.

A job made for you

  • Facilitate workshops (with either a Lean UX or similar approach); to help uncover problem statements and assumptions that can be used to guide the design process.
  • Translate concepts into wireframes and mockups that lead to intuitive user experiences for our clients.
  • Facilitate client’s product visions by researching, conceiving, wireframing, sketching, prototyping, and mocking up user experiences for digital products.
  • Design and deliver wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and prototypes optimised for a wide range of devices and interfaces.
  • Help support the Principal Designer with strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features.
  • Take a human-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.
  • Mentor junior designers and help them develop to the next level.
  • Get involved and help organise Design rituals for Designers out in the field.
  • Take smart risks and champion new ideas.

Other cool stuff you get to do

  • Be apart of an awesome Design team, and get to work with Tier 1 & 2 clients
  • Get involved with a start-up and earn equity
  • OVO Design Jam sessions with the wider team

Thing we are looking for

  • 5 years of solid design experience. Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for complete digital environments.
  • Ability to craft solutions with the usual UX software such as Sketch, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer.js, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.
  • Ability to work with clients to understand detailed requirements and design complete user experiences that meet client needs and vision.
  • Ability to translate wires to mid/high fidelity design (preferably using Sketch)
  • Ability to translate those designs into clickable prototypes for user testing (preferably using Invision)
  • Advanced experience in using experience design best practices to design solutions, and a basic understanding of mobile-first and responsive design (we'll get you up to speed).
  • An experienced understanding of human-centered design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns.
  • Ability to iterate your designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently.
  • Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to teams and clients.
  • Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.
  • Be willing to help teammates, share knowledge and experience with them, and learn from them.
  • Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.
  • Be passionate about all things design and innovation.
  • Visual Design skills are a super bonus ;)
  • Happy to go for coffee runs, clear the dish washer… (just checking if you were still reading).

General Competencies

  • Be willing to work on client-side (for a period of time - depending on project) and the Studio. Some travel may be required.
  • Proven ability to work autonomously and deliver against allocated work streams.
  • Organisational skills and attention to detail.
  • Exceptional ability to communicate, present and influence where needed.
  • Some experience working with business and/or technical stakeholders across organisations and internally.

Qualification

  • Bachelor degree in Graphic/UX Design/Industrial/Multimedia similar and/or Cognitive Psychology.


Let’s end with what is on offer?

  • You’ll be joining a fun and supportive team.
  • We’re small but we got big ambitions.
  • We’re located at the Paris end of the CBD.
  • The building we work in has showers, bike storage, a barrister coffee machine and a fully stocked fridge.
  • Participate in table tennis or our retro gaming nights.
  • Large quarterly events plus social gatherings.
  • When you start you get to Custom Design your own Nike Kicks on us.
  • Lunch and Learns
  • Have your birthday off on us

Application Software Engineer Team Lead

Company Name XCalibre Solutions Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 37 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

What makes our client different from the pack are their People, who continue to innovate and deliver world class products.\xa0 Located in the Melbourne's Eastern Suburbs, they have a solid history but, as importantly, a very exciting future.\xa0

Reporting into the Global Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for leading a gloabl team of Software Engineers developing state-of-the-art Application Software.

A few of the tasks you will be responsible for....

  • Managing the day-to-day activities of the Application Software Engineers (including those located overseas).
  • Providing\xa0 technical oversight and guidance on development projects.
  • Eliciting requirements for application logic and workflows from customers (typically OEMs) and Product Managers.
  • Ensuring Field Application Engineers, Product Managers, and Sales Personal are provided with knowledge of features and workflows within developed Application Software products.
  • Contributing to the Core Software Product backlogs and Hardware Product roadmaps.


You'll no doubt bring a lot of skills to the job, but here are the things you must have:


  • Tertiary degree in relevant Engineering field(s) and 5+ year’s experience in related role.
  • Experience with programming languages such as C# / WPF / XAML.
  • Understanding of modern software design principles and patterns.
  • Experience in User Interface design.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
  • Demonstrated experience in interfacing directly with customers.
  • Demonstrated experience in leading a team of Engineers, ideally including remotely located.
  • Demonstrated experience in Project Management skills, ideally in agile methodologies.

Bonus points for:


  • Knowledge of CNC Motion Control System architecture and technologies
  • CNC Application Software domain knowledge (eg. mill, lathe, grinding, profile cutting etc.)
  • Mandarin (written and oral)


NOTE:\xa0 This role will include regular overseas travel.
